alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 11:56PM EDT until August 25 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Warren County in north central Pennsylvania... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1156 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Clymer, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Scandia, Lottsville, Grand Valley, Warren South, Garland and Kinzua Dam. This includes the following highways... Route 6 from Columbus to near Ludlow. Route 62 from south of Tidioute to the New York border. State Road 59 from Warren to east of Kinzua Dam. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Stay inside a well built structure and keep away from windows. Very heavy rainfall is occurring with this severe thunderstorm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
